definition: to appoint (sb to a post)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
responsible person/coordinator
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
to get trampled on (idiom)/to be taken advantage of
to appoint people according to their merits (idiom); appointment on the basis of ability and integrity

sentences.english: We must appoint a new teacher soon.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一位總經理，他應當任人爲賢。

sentences.english: International posts should be filled according to merit.
sentences.chinese: 國際性職位應該任人唯賢。

sentences.english: If a crime is constituted, the person in charge shall be investigated for criminal responsibilities according to law.
sentences.chinese: 構成犯罪的，對責任人員依法追究刑事責任。

sentences.english: The Chinese people henceforth got rid have been organized the human , allow to oppressed's destiny .
sentences.chinese: 中國人民從此擺脫了受人擺佈，任人宰割的命運。

sentences.english: Your job is to do your job, not to be a pushover.
sentences.chinese: 工作就是工作，別做一隻任人捏的軟柿子。

sentences.english: We're the Illuminati , and we are not done.
sentences.chinese: 我們是光照派，我們絕不任人擺佈。

sentences.english: We can by no means allow ourselves to be trampled upon.
Consider your- self fortunate if you do not work for this type of company.
sentences.chinese: 你該慶幸，倘若你沒有在這種任人唯親的公司工作。

sentences.english: Calves are easily bound and slaughtered. Never knowing the reason why.
sentences.chinese: 牛兒任人捆縛宰割從來不知原因爲何。

sentences.english: Rumour is already rife here as to Dr. Trefoil's successor.
sentences.chinese: 關於特雷福伊爾博士的繼任人，此間已經謠言蜂起。

sentences.english: Yeah, most meritocratic, probably within the society, I'd say.
sentences.chinese: 是的，最任人唯才，可能在整個社會都是，我想說。

sentences.english: As a result, education is on the chopping block.
sentences.chinese: 因此教育成了砧板上的魚肉任人宰割。

sentences.english: The bishop had appointed no successor to him.
sentences.chinese: 主教沒有委派一個繼任人。

sentences.english: You can’t fix a systemwide problem by simply blaming or retraining individuals.
sentences.chinese: 對責任人進行指責或再培訓，不能修復系統性問題。

sentences.english: The chairman has designated Christina as his success or.
sentences.chinese: 主席已指定克莉絲蒂娜作他的繼任人。

sentences.english: Improving the quality of post-graduate program is the primary responsibility of the tutors.
sentences.chinese: 導師是保障和提高研究生培養質量的主要責任人。

definition: to slaughter/(fig.) to ride roughshod over/to take advantage of (others)
to arrange/to order about/to manipulate
gullible/easily bullied/weak
pitiful creature/wretch
to humiliate/humiliation
sacrificial knife and altar
(coll.) pushover/soft touch
lit. to be the meat on sb's chopping block (idiom)/fig. to be at sb's mercy
pinyin: ren2 wei2 dao1 zu3 , wo3 wei2 yu2 rou4

definition: to let (sth happen)/to allow (sb to do sth)/to submit to/to yield
to insult/to humiliate/to bully
to bully
to rely on others for the air one breathes (idiom); to depend on sb's whim for one's living
lit. lacking the strength even to truss a chicken (idiom)/fig. weak/unaccustomed to physical work
pinyin: shou3 wu2 fu4 ji1 zhi1 li4

definition: to ill-use/to humiliate/to degrade/to ruin/also pr. [zuo2 jian4]
to allow (sb to do as he pleases)
to bully and humiliate
